meanings.sent1: After losing the game, he became even sulkier than before.
meanings.sent2: She always gets sulkier when she's tired.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave a sulkier look when it saw the empty food bowl.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered in a sulkier fashion, hinting at a coming downpour.
meanings.sent5: His sulkier attitude made it hard to approach him for help.

meanings.definition: Showing resentment or dissatisfaction by sulking
meanings.sent1: Her sulkier expression clearly showed her displeasure.
meanings.sent2: He gave a sulkier response when asked to do more work.
meanings.sent3: The puppy put on a sulkier face when scolded for chewing shoes.
meanings.sent4: The old house had a sulkier appearance, as if holding onto past grudges.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's sulkier tone indicated she was not pleased with the class's behavior.

meanings.definition: Tending to sulk or be in a bad mood
meanings.sent1: The sulkier child often preferred to play alone.
meanings.sent2: She becomes sulkier when she doesn't get her favorite snack.
meanings.sent3: The sulkier clouds seemed to mirror his bad mood.
meanings.sent4: The sulkier atmosphere in the room made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent5: His sulkier nature made it challenging to cheer him up.
